snippet: If the annual rite of picking the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament winners gives fans anything, it’s the illusion of control.
abstract: Research published in The Journal of Gambling Studies shows that there are 9.2 quintillion ways to fill out NCAA men's basketball tournament bracket, and that even those with knowledge of team rankings and player statistics face odds of one in 128 billion for hitting perfect bracket.
lead_paragraph: If the annual rite of picking the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament winners gives fans anything, it’s the illusion of control.

headline.main: Tool of N.C.A.A. Bracket Ignorance: Your Basketball Smarts
